title: Two sums of money are proportional to 8:13. If the first sum is Rs.48, what is the addition of the two sums? - Quora

response.answer_text: When the ratio between 2 numbers is 8 : 13, if the first sum is 48, the second will be - (48/8) x 13 = 78 Sum of 2 numbers: 48 + 78 = 126.
The first sum is 6 times that of its ratio. (6*8) So the second sum should also be 6 times of its ratio ie 13. 6*13=78 Sum of the two numbers is 48+78=126
